section.title: Manage Requirements
section.para: The integrated requirement manager is a tool developed internally to optimize and simplify the requirement validation process. It is based on an external requirement repository (in this case Obeo) and used to make the link with a test manager (in this case Testlink) and a source manager (in this case SVN).

The requirement manager offers the following features:
Display and search for requirements of deposits configured in the application
Display and search for requirements and their statuses with respect to the application code
Display and search for requirements and their statuses with respect to the application tests
Configure requirement deposits
Display requirements

You can access the requirement application via the item circled in red in the left menu:

Click the "Requirement Repositories" tabs to manage your repositories. You can add two kind of repository :

sect2.title: Synchronize requirement repositories
sect2.para:
Synchronization
Each system can be selected for synchronization with Novaforge. The "Synchronize" button therefore starts synchronization. The result can be displayed in the Novaforge application log.
Requirements: Synchronize requirement repositoies (Obeo and Excel)
Tests: Synchronize requirement in TestLink, and look at which one is linked with a test.
Codes: Look at which requirement is coded.

sect2.title: Configure Requirement manager
sect2.para:
Configuration
You can configure :
Source path to synchronize : Allow you to synchronize only one folder with Source manager.
Automatic Synchronization
Activate: allow to active or not the automatic synchronization
Launch first synchronization: configure the first time of automatic synchronization
Repeat synchronization: configure the period between two automatic synchronization

sect2.title: Display requirements
sect2.para:
The requirement application offers three views to access the requirements:
Functional view: to display the requirement trees (and details of each requirement) for all deposits configured
Functional view
View by code: to display the requirements implemented in the project source code
View by code

itemizedlist.listitem: View by test: to display the requirements related to test cases in Testlink

sect2.para:
Legend of requirement coverage applied to the views by code and by test:
The requirement is not covered by the tests or by the code (for the corresponding view).
The requirement is covered by the tests or by the code (for the corresponding view).
The requirement is covered by the tests or by the code in a version preceding the current version.

sect2.title: Important!
sect2.para: In the above example, we have assumed that a code manager and a test manager are present for the project, but the application can nevertheless operate without one or all of these managers.
